main event: A circular, metallic object was observed moving at high speeds between 400-700 mph over New York City on June 12, 1954.
interesting points: The object was approximately the size of a peach pit and had a silvery metallic composition.
The object exhibited a complex maneuver pattern, including straight-line, oscillating, swerving, and sudden disappearance.
The object was observed for only 10-15 seconds, but its altitude could not be determined.
The object did not produce any audible sound.
The witness, a 15-year-old in New York City, assumed the object was attempting to avoid observation.
